tool.name: Upload2GCS
tool.displayname: Upload File to Google Cloud Storage and Convert to GEE Asset

param.name: project_id
param.displayname: Specify the Google Cloud project ID
param.dialogReference: Specify the Google Cloud project ID associated with Google Cloud Storage.

param.name: bucket_name
param.dialogReference: All buckets available in the specified project will be listed here. Select one bucket.

param.name: bucket_folder
param.displayname: Select the folder within the bucket
param.dialogReference: All folders in the selected bucket will be listed here. Select one folder.

param.name: files
param.displayname: Choose a local file to upload
param.dialogReference:
Choose files from local storage in format (".tif", ".shp", ".csv", ".zip", ".tfrecord"). Select one or multiple files to convert to Earth Engine asset.

Each .zip file can only contain one .shp file and its accessory files (.shx, .dbf, .prj, .cpg). When you choose .shp file, please make sure the accessory files are in the same folder. The script will automatically upload the accessory files.

param.name: upload_asset
param.displayname: Upload the file to Google Earth Engine
param.dialogReference: Check this box if you want to convert the selected files to Earth Engine asset.

param.name: asset_type
param.dialogReference:
Choose asset type between image and table.

  1. Choose image if you want to convert files to image or image collection

  2. Choose table if you want to convert files to feature collection(s)

param.name: asset_id
param.dialogReference:
Specify an asset tag for the file(s). The available options are given below:

  1. Select one file with asset type as image. The input value is the image asset tag.

  2. Select multiple files with asset type as image. The input value is the image collection asset tag. The image ID in the collection will be automatically assigned with the file name.

  3. Select one file with asset type as table. The input value is the feature collection asset tag.

  4. Select multiple files with asset type as table. The input value is the folder that contains multiple feature collections. The feature collection ID will be automatically assigned with the file name.

tool.summary:
This script uploads file(s) from local storage to Google Cloud Storage and converts file(s) to an Earth Engine asset. It is used to share dataset on Google Cloud and the Earth Engine platform. The file(s) will be assigned with a user-specified asset tag. There are two options to locate the target files:

  1. If you know the gsutil URI of the target file, just specify the project ID and paste the URI to the file input. If you are dealing with a large bucket with lots of folders and files, it is recommended to use file URI directly. Otherwise, it will take time to locate the file.

  2. If not, specify the project ID and select the bucket, folder and target file one by one.

You can convert the file(s) to the following types of Earth Engine assets:

  1. Image when you select one file in '.tif' format

  2. Image collection when you select multiple files in '.tif' format

  3. Feature collection when you select one file in '.shp', '.csv', '.zip' or '.tfrecord' format.

  4. Feature collections when you select multiple files in '.shp', '.csv', '.zip' or '.tfrecord' format. Each file will be converted to a feature collection, respectively.

idCitation.resTitle: Upload File to Google Cloud Storage and Convert to GEE Asset
